title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
Investors are cooling to one of the hottest bets on Wall Street as new regulatory scrutiny of special-purpose acquisition companies cuts the flood of new issues to a trickle and share prices drop.

---

Apple Music disclosed to artists that it pays a penny per stream, according to a letter viewed by The Wall Street Journal.

---

Morgan Stanley lost $911 million when Archegos imploded last month, tarnishing a record-setting quarter for the Wall Street firm.

---

New estimates from the Fed suggest that the economic toll from the pandemic for smaller businesses wasn't as bad as feared.

---

The Dow and S&P 500 rose 0.5% and 0.4%, respectively, with both indexes closing at records. The Nasdaq gained 0.1%.

---

Boeing said a potential electrical problem in 737 MAX jets affects more areas of the aircraft's flight deck than previously known.

---

NASA awarded a contract to SpaceX to build a new capsule to land astronauts on the moon.

---

Turkey will ban the use of cryptocurrencies as a form of payment.
